    • Method Detail

      • getMethod

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method getMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                                                 java.lang.String methodName,
                                                 java.lang.Class<?>... args)
                                          throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
                                                 java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                 java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        Get a method agnostic.
        If the method is static send the respective class in parameter object.
        Parameters:
        object - to get a method
        methodName - name of the method
        args - the list of parameters method
        Returns:
        method specified by arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager denies access
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if a matching method is not found
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException - if object parameter is null

      • invoke

        public static java.lang.Object invoke(InvokeItf data)
                               throws java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError,
                                      java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Invoke the method described by InvokeItf.
        Parameters:
        data - describing the invocation
        Returns:
        the invocation result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the method is an instance method and the specified object argument is not an instance of the class or interface declaring the underlying method (or of a subclass or implementor thereof); if the number of actual and formal parameters differ; if an unwrapping conversion for primitive arguments fails; or if, after possible unwrapping, a parameter value cannot be converted to the corresponding formal parameter type by a method invocation conversion
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if this Method object enforces Java language access control and the underlying method is inaccessible
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the underlying method throws an exception
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified object is null and the method is an instance method
        java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError - if the initialisation provoked by this method fails

      • invoke

        public static java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object object,
                                      java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                      java.lang.Object... args)
                               throws java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError,
                                      java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Invoke the method described by arguments.
        NOTE: if one argument of method to invoke is an array, this has to be cast to object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object the underlying method is invoked from
        method - to invoke
        args - the arguments used for the method call
        Returns:
        invoke result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the method is an instance method and the specified object argument is not an instance of the class or interface declaring the underlying method (or of a subclass or implementor thereof); if the number of actual and formal parameters differ; if an unwrapping conversion for primitive arguments fails; or if, after possible unwrapping, a parameter value cannot be converted to the corresponding formal parameter type by a method invocation conversion
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if this Method object enforces Java language access control and the underlying method is inaccessible
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the underlying method throws an exception
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified object is null and the method is an instance method
        java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError - if the initialisation provoked by this method fails
